lead_paragraph: A new winemaker brought in by Coppola looks ahead 50 years, with ideas that run counter to Napa’s conventional wisdom.

headline.print_headline: Inglenook Focuses on the Long Term to Regain Glory
headline.main: Inglenook Focuses on the Long Term to Regain Its Glory

snippet: A new winemaker brought in by Coppola looks ahead 50 years, with ideas that run counter to Napa’s conventional wisdom.
abstract: Eric Asimov The Pour column focuses on Philippe Bascaules, general manager of Inglenook Vineyards in Napa Valley; Bascaules was hired by owner Francis Ford Coppola to renew winery and began 50-year plan in 2011 that contains methods unconventional to regional grape growers; vineyard is once again producing quality wines and is slated to release 100 percent cabernet sauvignon later in 2016.
